properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 4:20PM EST until February 10 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for Small Streams in...
Central Tyler County in northern West Virginia...

* Until 1000 PM EST.

* At 420 PM EST, Rain gauge data indicated rainfall from earlier
today was resulting in significant rises along area creeks and
streams, including Middle Island Creek. Flooding is ongoing or
expected to begin shortly in the warning area.

* At 400 PM EST, the stage of Middle Island Creek near Middlebourne
was at 15.31 feet. The estimated flood stage is 16 feet. The creek
is expected to crest this evening between 16 and 17 feet and then
slowly fall overnight. At stages near 16 feet, fields and low and
poor drainage areas along the creek and associated tributaries
begin to flood.

This includes the following streams and drainages...
Long Run, Gorrell Run, Middle Island Creek, McElroy Creek, Pratt
Run, Muddy Creek, Conaway Run, Hills Run, Wheeler Run, Woodburn Run,
Jefferson Run, Big Run and Arnold Creek.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
